p: The observed effect of Tmin on dengue transmission is consistent with findings from prior studies in the Americas, which also found that Tmin was a better predictor of dengue transmission than mean or maximum temperature [ 48– 52]. Tmin appears to be a key regulating climate parameter for dengue. In Barbados, high values of Tmin were 25.5°C, the lower end of the optimal temperature range for endemic dengue transmission (26–29°C) [ 13].
